course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Laboratory for General Physics I
course.description: A laboratory course to accompany PHYS 1111/PHYS 1112/PHYS 1312. Experiments in mechanics and heat are chosen to illustrate the experimental foundations of physics presented in the lecture courses.
course.corequisites: PHYS 1111 OR PHYS 1112 OR PHYS 1312

reviews.author: Spaceship
reviews.comment_content:
Everyone feels like Albert Einstein in this course, believing they have disproved some of the fundamental laws of classical mechanics. The only problem is----this is a lab course for classical mechanics, not modern physics.
There is simply too much emphasis on the propagation of random errors but not a single f*ck was given to systematic errors. [eg. Students are not asked to keep only the data that made sense so full credit was given to students who got 30-50% percentage error. But if you miss the +/-0.01g error of measuring things using the accursed electronic balance (which only accounts to ~0.001% of the error), your lab report marks will be below mean. Isn't it fascinating?]
Anyways, this lab is still a good way to help you develop practical skills, which will definitely help you handle everyday appliances, or perhaps... realizing your not-so-distant dreams of becoming a Nobel-bearing scientist.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Su is nice and is always willing to give advice to those in need, be it at tutorials or practical sessions. However, some of her marking rubrics are quite ridiculous.
And don't get me started on the TAs...
reviews.comment_grading:
The only thing good about this course is: the grading is EVEN better than PHYS1112 (i.e. SUPER GREAT)!
The scores will be normalized for each lab section too so it is okay to be with a TA who gives low lab performance marks (30%, another 70% for lab reports). Preparing for labs is important as finishing labs early is the one true standard for giving out performance marks (given that you don't break any lab equipment or say bad things about your TA).
I got above mean 1.5sd-->A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is absolutely too light for a 1-cred course! Look, every week,you only need to write an Excel file for error propagation in about 1/2 hours, discuss the "reading comprehension" problems with your peers for about 2 hours, finish last week's lab report in the blink of an eye and finally attend another 2 hours of doing wonderful practical work with men of your age. Oh and btw, you should also prepare your labs beforehand and arrive at least 15 minutes before your lab session commences if you want your lab performance marks to stick with the mean. Don't you realize how lucky you are to be able to receive proper education? Tens of thousands of children all across the world are suffering from hunger and yet you can't even afford to skip lunch to show some respect to the grandiose enlightenment of physics?
廢青。

reviews.author: A34567890
reviews.title: Do not recommend.
reviews.comment_content:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching: TAs are friendly and helpful, but tutorials are not useful at all. Feels more like a 4-month long exam with some assistance.
reviews.comment_grading: Not sure about the final letter grade, but marks are sometimes deducted from lab reports without comments. This is irritating because it is hard to improve when I am not receiving adequate constructive criticism. I ended up having to compare with other students to find out which part of the report I had done wrong.
reviews.comment_workload:
For a one-credit course, this is 100% an E.
E for excessive.  
This course is a must-take if you enjoy torturing yourself.
Recommend CHEM1050 instead if you are taking a lab course only to fulfill science school requirements.

Edit: Do not go to lab sleep deprived.

reviews.author: Mango
reviews.comment_content:
10 Labs
M1. The  Atwood Machine (PHYS 1112 L2-3)
part 1. constant total mass
part 2. constant net force
M2. Projectile Motion (PHYS 1112 L1)
part 1. Measurement of the initial velocity, time-of-flight and horizontal travelling distance of the projectile
part 2. study of the effect of different angles of inclination
M3. Centripetal force (PHYS 1112 L3)
Part 1. Centripetal force vs. Angular velocity at fixed values of M and R
Part 2. Centripetal force vs. Radius at fixed values of M and ω
M4. Work, Energy and Friction (PHYS 1112 L3-L5)
Part 1. Measurement of Work and Energy
Part 2. Measurement of the coefficients of kinetic and static friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum (PHYS 1112 L6-L7)
Part 1.inelastic collision
Part 2. elastic collision
M6 Rotational Motion (PHYS 1112 L8-L10)
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
Part 1. Angular momentum before capture
Part 2. Angular momentum after capture
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion(PHYS 1112 L14)
Part 1: Determination of the spring constant
Part 2. Measurement of the oscillation period
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String (PHYS 1112 L17)
Part 1. Resonance modes
Part 2. Velocity of wave propagation
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization (PHYS 1112 L18)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng 交代得好清楚
Ma Junwei 有少少內地口音，解釋尚可。 Lab performance 係 Zoom polling，要很明白相關課題的概念，才能獲得高分。Junwei 通常都係照manual 讀，未必有很多解釋。

reviews.author: Squidgy
reviews.title: Significant numbers suck
reviews.comment_content: Experiments about general physics one.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Well I think the course is quite irrelevant to the experiments you’ll do in the lab. You can just skip it.
Lab partner will change in every two weeks, it’s a good chance to meet new friends.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% lab performance
70% lab report
Total score 93.875
It’s an A, so I dunno what score would reach to A+.
Please pay attention to the “units” “significant numbers” cuz TA is strict about these things.
reviews.comment_workload: It’s heavy, the instructor and TA over emphasized the importance of significant numbers, every week I spent a lot of time on doing lab reports and checking the numbers. Since it’s a one credit course, it will rly piss you off.

reviews.author: Jim Jim
reviews.title: Nice course if you like lab report
reviews.comment_content: This course is to let you do experiments on the topics that you have learnt in PHYS1112. The lab report will not be so difficult as there are many sources out there. Simply Google it.
reviews.comment_teaching: There will be a briefing session at the very beginning of the lab session. They may give you some tips during this session.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is based on your class level. In the other words, it depends on your luck.
BE AWARE OF YOUR LAB PARTNER even though you cannot choose your own.
reviews.comment_workload:
Being a 1-cred course this workload is a bit too much.
One lab report and one pre-lab every week.

reviews.author: humanppplus
reviews.title: Exhausting course
reviews.comment_content:
Mechanics
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String

Heat
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization

The content looks fine, but the execution is not that good. You don't really learn a lot from it except error propagation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To put it simply, HAN, Yilong is a mascot of this course. I only see him ~4 times this semester, twice when he comes to the lab occasionally to, idk, blow water with the TA? Once in the class photo session, and once in the first tutorial session (sidenote theres 3 tut sessions in the whole course, went to the first one and never went again. useless). I honestly do not know the purpose of HAN, Yilong aside from assigning the final letter grades.

The TA and technician for my lab session are very friendly, but unluckily I sometimes can't the Indian accent of my TA. But it's alright.
reviews.comment_grading: Ok grade for me, which is the only somewhat-good thing about this course. Also since this is a one-credit course, even if you lan grade it wouldn't affect your CGA a lot.
reviews.comment_workload:
EXTREMELY heavy workload considering this is a one-credit course. For me this course worths 4-5 credits in terms of workload. One lab report every week, usually involving plotting graphs and dealing with error propagation. For most of the values you need to calculate out the error range, which is very very tedious. Also the after-lab questions in the lab reports are quite weird and sometimes unrelated. Like in the final lab about latent heat, the last question was "Speculate on how the latent heat of vapourization might influence climate and weather systems."

btw the lab reports for every year are the same so u guys have to do this also lmao

reviews.author: Billy0104
reviews.comment_content: same as other
reviews.comment_teaching: the TAs are nice and willing to help whenever u hv any problems in doing the experiment. just go and ask them if u hv any questions in doing the experiment and writing the report
reviews.comment_grading:
easy to get an A for finishing the report nice and fine
but difficult to get an A+ since u will need a perfect report
reviews.comment_workload:
for a 1 credit course, the workload is too heavy.
u have to write a lab report every week, which can take up to a few hours for u to finish it as u have to do tons of calculations, graphing and summary writing
(btw if u hv bought A+source u may finish the lab report within 10 mins since the questions hv never been change for years)

DON'T REG THIS if not necessary

reviews.author: Ninja
reviews.comment_content:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum

reviews.comment_teaching: Tutorials to teach you data anaylsis, error propagation but not in every week.
reviews.comment_grading:
As it was online mode in this semester, we just need to jot down the data from TA and finish the report in one week.
I got full mark for most of the reports (part A for prelab and part B&C for data anaylsis)
finally got A-
I think not very difficult to attain A range but make sure to be careful as the mean for every reports are high and most of the students can get full mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lab every week, so you have to do lab reports every week.
Workload is heavy for one-credit course.

reviews.comment_content:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force

reviews.comment_teaching: The TAs are nice and willing to help
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is satisfactory
It depends heavily on your lab report than class performance
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a lot lab reports to do which requires u to calculate and plot many many graphs… quite tedious 🥲🥲

reviews.author: Eyjafjalla
reviews.comment_content:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization

You can learn their basic concept on Phys1112, so it is easy for you to handle.
reviews.comment_teaching: TA is quite good. I believe that they are welcome to answer your questions. If you have some mistakes, TA will remind and help you. Spend more time reading the instructions and the reminder from TA.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each lab score will be determined based on your (i) lab performance (30%) and (ii) lab reports (70%).

If you have done all ten experiments, the best nine will be used to calculate the final lab grade. So take it easy.

If you want to get better performance, you may finish the lab quickly and safely. Before every lab, it is important for you to know the whole procedure clearly.

For the lab report, it is significant to write and calculate the error of each data. Trying to write more things and plot the graph clearly (including the linear function of the data and error if necessary).

The mean of each part is around 80% of the full marks. But if you want to get an A grade, then you may get around 95%.

Finally, I got A+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is big, you are going to do a lab report per week. If you want to get an A range, then you may spend more time reading the instructions. However, this course is only 1 credit, so you may consider if it is worth spending time on it.

reviews.author: Philosophy_Cat
reviews.title: A good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
This semester is switched to online mode, there are in total 8 experiments and 1 home project.

Experiments:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization

Home Project
The instructor will describe the objective and general direction of four different Home Project topics. Students will choose one of them and use household materials, such as rubber band, strings, speakers, etc. to conduct the experiment. In the project, you need to
1. write a proposal to describe your plan to achieve the objective of the project including experiment setup, experiment procedures and design a data sheet
2. conduct the experiment at home
3. write a short (max. one A4 size page) report to summarized the finding and the answers to topic objective. Data sheet should be included in the report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Cheung gives detailed explanations in tutorials. The tutorial about handling error is useful for error analysis in lab reports and home project. He also provides constructive advice in the tutorial for home project. Also, the lab technician and TA are helpful, they are willing to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
8 labs (performance + report): 80%, 10% for each lab
Home Project: 20%

The grading is quite good. My total score is 97.45/100, finally got an A+. But be aware that the mean score of this course is very high (around 85 to 90/100), you should seek for resources so that you can complete lab reports with a high score.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a bit heavy for a 1-credit course. You need to complete pre-lab questions and lab reports, which require 1 to 2 hours per week. In case this course is still conducted in online mode, you may need to do a home project, and I would suggest you to finish it as soon as possible. You need time for analyzing error (which may require difficult maths) and modifying your report.

reviews.author: GloriaGuo
reviews.comment_content:
General physics I Experiment
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Cheung is a good teacher and TAs are very helpful. There will be demonstrations by TA before every experiment which really help you understand the experiment procedure.
reviews.comment_grading:
lab performance 30% lab reports 70%.
Mean of lab reports : around 80/100.
Mean of lab performance : around 9/10.
Be careful about the sig. fig. and remember to write down necessary steps of calculation. Do not skip labs.
lab report: 94/100.
performance: 9/10.
finally A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pre lab questions and lab report, take about 1 hour every week.
Check the sig. fig. with TA before you leave the lab.
Better get prepared for every lab and you can finish sooner.
The workload is a bit heavy for a 1cre course.

reviews.author: qwed
reviews.comment_content: There isn't much content here that isn't covered here in 1112. I would make up numbers if I was you, there is no incentive to actually do the labs legit, if you know the theory behind the calculation, you can hack your data.
reviews.comment_teaching: Do not skip labs! I skipped too many labs and got deducted because of this. I suggest you go and play on your phone because the content isn't helpful for exams in 1112.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is normalized so its not too bad, don't expect to get an A though.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload isn't too much, lab is usually required for physics majors and it helps you prepare for future labs. If you find a good group then you should be fine. Don't go for your friends, trust me.

reviews.author: Nietzsche
reviews.comment_content:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually you can just follow those notes and then complete those reports. If you have questions during experiment , TA will answer and help you in order to make sure you finish the experiment. Pre lab is very important that they won't tell all the details because you are expected to have enough understanding before experiment.
reviews.comment_grading: Most of people should get A range and B range. Performance	30% and Lab Report70%. Mean of report are quite high that at least 80/100 in every report. I finally got a B+ that my overall result is above mean around 4 marks.
reviews.comment_workload: one week one lab and one report. You need to spend a lot of time  to understand the details and procedures of experiment and answer questions in report that do not have enough hints and the difficulty is quite high.

reviews.author: Ykiki
reviews.title: An interesting lab course
reviews.comment_content: There are 10 lab reports in total. The order is as same as the PHYS1112 teaching schedule. If you finish 10 lab, one may be dropped out and only 9 are counted.
reviews.comment_teaching: TAs are very helpful. If you ask them questions about lab report, they will try to lead you to find out the answers by yourself. Also, they would tell you some techniques on writing lab reports. Remember to count the sig. fig. very CAREFULLY! Each mistake will deduct you 5 marks.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is okay but it is hard to get a very high grade like A or A+. The mean of the lab reports are very high like 90 something or above. You must get nearly full marks every time in order to get a high grade. Be well prepared before lab session and come early would help. Your lab partner will be changed each 2 week ramdomly.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite heavy actually. You are required to write a lab report within one week. So start writing earlier and discuss with your lab partners. Don't be a deadline fighter or you may regret.

reviews.author: JUNN
reviews.comment_content: Just a practical version of whatever we learn in PHYS 1111, PHYS 1112, or PHYS 1312.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no teaching going on. 4 tutorials to attend but none of them was very useful except error propagation tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading: Even though I didn't receive my letter grade, the lab report is graded very harshly. You are supposed to be perfect in every aspect of data recording. Makes sense why it is very harsh.
reviews.comment_workload: Too much for a 1 credit course. Lab report has 3 sections, pre-lab, during lab and post lab. didn't like the immensity of workload.

最後A-

reviews.author: KevinWLY
reviews.comment_content: useful knowledge to let you understand the practical nature of physics, especially in making measurement and taking error, so a B is given in this criteria
reviews.comment_teaching: little guidance is given, just enough for you to finish your work
reviews.comment_grading: grade is ok, acceptable, quite very reasonable, fair, so a B is given for this criteria
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is totally not acceptable
as a 1-cred course, the workload is even more than other 3/4 cred courses. make sure u have enough time to finish the god damn lab report.
It should have been a 3-cred course

reviews.author: Bread
reviews.comment_content:
This course is designed to complement with the standard year 1 physics course (PHYS11112/PHYS1312), covering experiments about some of the topics taught in these courses.
The course includes 10 experiments:
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching:
For the tutorial session, Dr. Su's teaching is quite average. In fact, since the powerpoints are available in the course website anyway, it is possible to just not attend the tutorials and be fine, since nothing interesting happens in the tutorial anyways (assuming there is one that week)
As for the lab itself, there really isn't much in the way of teaching. If you want to talk about the technicians, they are quite willing to help. As for the TAs, I wish they could just stop deducting so many marks for the numerical error part--you can lose so many marks there it is not even funny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Your top 9 scores in your 10 experiments will be taken for grade calculation (assuming you attend all lectures, of course). The score for each experiment is counted as follow:
Practical: 30%
Report: 70%
From what I know, the mean of this course is around B+, and you need to be above 0.5 SD to get A.
Thanks to the 'amazing' TAs, the score between each session can vary to a rather large degree, so as a result, the score is normalized for grading purpose. To demonstrate, I shall use my score as an example:
My overall: ~83.7
Mean(according to canvas): 82.6
Average SD: 5.4
Using this calculation, I would seem to get around B+/A-. However, in reality, my TA gives really low score in general:
Mean: ~77, SD: ~7
so considering this, I am in fact almost 1SD above my lab session, so at the end, I get an A. So when you compare your canvas score and see a lot of your score being below average, do not be too worried: the score between each session can very a LOT (Some lab session have mean 88, SD 3), but after the normalization, your result will turn out fine.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to hand in a report one week after every lab session. The report includes data manipulation and analysis. It will get less tedious once you learn how to use excel, but still, it is quite tedious.

reviews.author: M.T
reviews.comment_content:
Involves a total of ten experiments, 9 about mechanics and 1 for heat.
The topics are:
1. Atwood Machine
2. Projectile Motion
3. Centripetal Force
4. Work, Energy and Friction
5. Conservation of Linear Momentum
6. Rotational Motion
7. Conservation of Angular Momentum
8. Simple Harmonic Motion
9. Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
And
10. Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization

In general , the experiments are not too difficult, except for some experiments where the apparatus are in extremely poor condition and you may not be able to obtain expected results. (e.g. You probably won't obtain a conserved linear momentum result EVEN in ELASTIC COLLISION)

Taking attendance is required.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Su is very kind and very willing to answer any questions with regard to the experiments.

There will be different TAs for each laboratory session, some of them are good, while some not. It depends on pure luck.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading consist of performance score and lab report score.

How the TAs give their performance score is a myth, just pray before entering the laboratory.

It is heard that the overall grading is very good.

Note that since everyone will get about the same score in their lab report, the S.D. will not be very great. The mean score in general is ~74 - 88 this sem. (Differ from each lab sessions) If you don't make stupid mistakes you will be fine.

Grade : A+ (I got above mean 2.1 s.d.)
According to grading scale in previous years, you can get a A+ with 1.8 s.d above mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
Compare to other 1XXX lab courses, the workload is quite high.

You are expected to read the lab manual before each session, and answer some pre-lab questions.

Pre- lab questions are easy and help you prepare for the experiment (And it is a part of your lab report), So it is advised to treat them seriously.

Post-lab questions are sometimes quite difficult and it has A SHITLOAD OF TRAPS.

Including (But not limited to) :
forgetting to take measurement uncertainties / incorrect number of significant figures / forget to add error bars on excel graphs ...

reviews.author: alalal
reviews.comment_content:
The content is linked to PHYS1112 so it aided my understanding of some topics in PHYS1112 for me.
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Cheung teaches about lab skills in tutorials. The tutorials are very informative and detailed, so attending the tutorial helped me to complete the lab reports. The pace of teaching is just right too.
TAs and lab technicians are kind and will always welcome questions to be asked during the experiments. Demonstrations by TA are helpful for our experiments too.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% lab performance, 70% lab reports.
Lab performance -- just based on how your TA wanted to grade you, but finishing the experiment early would help you get a better grade. The mean of the performance mark is mostly around 9/10.
Lab reports -- keywords must be present for pre-lab and post-lab questions, be aware of the use of significant figures, an incorrect number of significant figures would lead to a great mark deduction. The mean of the lab report mark is around 75-85/100.
I got around 93/100 for lab reports and around 9/10 for performance, got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
A maximum of only one lab can be skipped in the whole semester without mark deduction, so don't skip labs! Four tutorials over the semester, attendance will not be taken though.
One lab report to be completed + preparation of the next lab every week. It may take some time to complete lab reports since some questions may be quite tricky. Some experiments may require complicated procedures, so for me, spending time to study the lab manual before each lab session worths. No midterm and final exam.

reviews.author: 木村森美
reviews.title: 好grade
reviews.comment_content:
1112內容              1112 stuff
tutorial 好悶          that tutorial is quite tedious
主要係error           emphasis on error when dealing with lab report
corr. to ?? sig. fig.
reviews.comment_teaching:
lab 個tutor好好人 唔識可以問
that young tutor in the lab and the technician are very nice and approachable. feel free to ask them

有briefing 最好抄notes
jot notes during the briefing
reviews.comment_grading:
做得一般般 有D hea但有B+
1 cred但的確係CGA強心針
reviews.comment_workload:

heavy workload but worth to reg

reviews.author: 想當年
reviews.comment_content:
10 labs：
M1 The Atwood Machine
M2 Projectile Motion
M3 Centripetal Force
M4 Work, Energy and Friction
M5 Conservation of Linear Momentum
M6 Rotational Motion
M7 Conservation of Angular Momentum
M8 Simple Harmonic Motion
M9 Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
H1 Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization


4 tutorials：
1)Scientific Graphing and Data analysis
2)Data analysis-statistics
3)Error propagation
4)Dimensional analysis
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Cheung教得幾清晰，容易明

TA Mr SOU Chon Man都好helpful，幾nice
reviews.comment_grading:
All the experiments are equally weighted. Each lab score will be determined based on your (i) lab performance (30%) and (ii) lab reports (70%).
Dropping of the lowest lab score: If you complete* all 10 experiments, at the end of the semester the best 9 scores will be used to calculate your final lab grade. That is, your lowest score will be dropped. This dropping policy will be applied only to students who complete all 10 experiments including makeup. For students who did not complete all experiments, all the grades will be counted including zeros from the missing labs.

Mean：
performance 好似超過8分（out of 10）
report 都80幾（out of 100）

個人：
Performance 主要攞8，Report就大約95，A grade，都唔錯
reviews.comment_workload:
對1 credit course，workload 感覺算大
每星期2hours lab，加上做report，起碼30mins至1hr。（可能我做得慢啦）

reviews.author: app_Sci
reviews.comment_content:
The course conducts experiments relevant to the PHYS 1111/1112 course. The list is listed in other comments thus I will skip it.
More than the experiments itself, this course also emphasizes on experimental errors.
Some said that the course should emphasize on also experimental methods.
No final exams or midterms.
Attending tutorials is not necessary every week, only in the specified weeks.
Attendance in tutorials and lab sessions will be recorded.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In my opinion, she is a good teacher.
At the last session of tutorial, we were allowed to give advices and raise questions relevant to the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite nice compared to other courses. I got above mean a little bit and got an A-.
It was said that the mean is around B+.
The mark is given by the following proportion:
30% performance
70% Lab Report
If you attend all 10 labs, and submitted the lab report on time, the lab session with the lowest mark will be dropped and the average mark of the other nine will be taken as the final sum.
However, if you fail to attend 1 or more lab and cannot give a valid excuse, then the average of all 10 will be taken into account (including the missing 0s).
There might be lots of deviation from different TA's scores, but in spring semester, there is only one lab session, so that is not a problem.
PS: At the end of the tutorial I asked her about the grading of the course, she said she will give grade in a very lenient way. In her words, "I will try to give a better grade. Lots of you are tired from other courses. I will give C range only to really really really bad people."
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload mainly come from the lab report that is done every week. It is also highly recommended to read the lab manuals before doing the actual experiment so that you will be familiar with the experiment session and thus gain a higher mark in performance.
You will approximately need about 3-4 hour every week for this course.

reviews.comment_content:
10 Experiments
1. Atwood Machine
2. Projectile Motion
3. Centripetal Force
4. Work, Energy and Friction
5. Conservation of Linear Momentum
6. Rotational Motion
7. Conservation of Angular Momentum

9. Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
And
10. Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Su 幾好人，有咩問題可以問佢
reviews.comment_grading:
30% lab performance
70% lab report
lab performance啲分唔知佢點比，好飄忽
我高一個sd有A，好唔好grade就見仁見智
reviews.comment_workload:
不大
有tutorial， 不過好少堂，同埋啲堂可以唔去，上canvas睇翻佢啲powerpoint都識
每次lab之前最好睇一次lab manual 睇下點做，因為當你做lab時你可能會自亂陣腳
每次lab之後都要做lab report，唔算太難

reviews.author: Jon-1
reviews.comment_content:
The course consists of 10 experiments. Each experiment has 3 parts: pre-lab questions, experimental data, and lab analysis.
The experiments are on:
1. Atwood Machine
2. Projectile Motion
3. Centripetal Force
4. Work, Energy and Friction
5. Conservation of Linear Momentum
6. Rotational Motion
7. Conservation of Angular Momentum
8. Simple Harmonic Motion
9. Standing Waves on a Vibrating String
And
10. Specific Heat and Latent Heat of Vaporization
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Yumian Su is very helpful and willing to answer any questions that you might have.
reviews.comment_grading:
Score of each experiment is calculated according to:
Lab Performance: 30%
Lab Report: 70%
The score for lab performance seemed arbitrary to me.
I got low scores for lab report for the first couple of experiment, then understood what they want in it and got better scores.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload light. Every week you need to perform 1 experiment, complete its analysis and do the pre-lab questions for the next experiment. I usually did it the night before the next experiment (It took me a few hours to finish it)

reviews.author: SH
reviews.title: Relaxing laboratory time but heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: PHYS1113 mainly focus on mechanics experiments which are also the syllabus of PHYS1112. 9/10 are mechanics experiments while the last one is about heat. Most of them are pretty easy to understand and has no difficulty to obtain accurate data. However, a good partner is really important, otherwise you may lag behind the schedule. It could enhance your understanding in PHYS1112 knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Su is a really nice tutor. She is willing to answer you any questions and sometimes may even help you to set up your equipments. However, her tutorial is quiet boring but you better go to the tutorial because she will warn you to avoid some minor mistakes.

The other factor is TA, they will grade your lab performance and lab report. Well. I could say this depends on your luck.

Technicians are very nice and amusing. As all of them are HongKongers, you could ask for help in Cantonese.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is easy to get high marks in report as the calculations are simple and phenomenon are easy to explain.

However, lab performance is biased. As each section has different TA, it depends on whether how strict the TA is. Although Dr. Su will compare lab performance grading of every lab section, bias still exists.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is a bit heavier when comparing with lifs and chem lab. You have to hand in weekly report. A lot of calculations is required which normally takes much time. But no mid-term and final exam are its advantages.

reviews.author: grqm
reviews.comment_content:
10個lab
9個mechanics 1個thermal
每個lab有2個鐘
但係通常1粒鐘就可以做完
多數都係set up完用電腦拎data同埋plot graph就走得

M1: The Atwood Machine
M2: Projectile Motion

其實個course既重點係error propagation

Tutorial講得唔錯
又有心答問題
reviews.comment_grading:
30% lab performance

都算好grade

但係我估冇乜人拎到A+
reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: JY_XueBa_Not
reviews.title: High Workload yet Fun course
reviews.comment_content: The content consist of 10 experiments revolving 9 Force and Mechanics labs and a heat lab. It provides an excellent opportunity to put the theories you learnt in PHYS1112 into practical use.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite good, but you won't learn much unless you approach Dr. Su after class or during lab session , She is very kind and willing to explain the notes comprehensively.
reviews.comment_grading:
The gradings are not out yet, but the class mean and S.D is very close, mean is around 77 to 88 with S.D ~3-8.

30% Lab performance
70% Lab report.

Note: Be punctual, Be Active and Be careful (especially writing error ranges in your report!)
reviews.comment_workload: 2 Hours lab per week plus handing in lab reports, the workload is considerably high for a 1 credit course.

reviews.author: Jeremy
reviews.comment_content: Content is related to PHYS1112 and it is quite useful to understand more on PHYS1112
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very willing to give advice and opinions on how to do better in the lab report and give help when you face any difficulties during the experiment.
reviews.comment_grading: If you do the experiment seriously, the lab performance will not be bad and it will stick to the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is more than other courses. There is one lab report per week and it is quite hard to finish in the beginning, but it will be better when you are familiar with the lab report.

reviews.author: Aloha
reviews.comment_content: PHYS1112嘅附屬lab course, 內容同1112差唔多, 總共有10個experiment, 9個同mechanics有關, 1個同 heat有關
reviews.comment_teaching:
TA幾好人 有咩唔明會幾樂意解答你
instructor有時會嚟lab睇下學生做lab 同埋吹下水咁
reviews.comment_grading:
30% lab performance, 70% lab report
幾好grade A range 幾易拎
reviews.comment_workload:
每星期做2個鐘lab 交一份lab report 答下問題咁 唔算太難
以1 credit嘅lab course嚟講workload算大
如果係sci school 要lab course嚟fulfill school requirements, chem同lfis會輕鬆好多
